com.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.toolbar

Class CardBeanToolBarObservable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.toolbar.CardBeanToolBarObservable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer

    public class CardBeanToolBarObservable
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.Observer
    This class represents the application's toolbar by managing an internal JToolBar object and extending Observable to provide observers the possibility to react to user interaction with the toolbar. The actual JToolBar object can be retrieved through method getToolBar().
    Author:
    Sebastian Dine

      • setSelectedCard

        public void setSelectedCard(CardBean cardBean)
        Sets the internally referenced CardBean object which is used to provide corresponding toolbar functionalities.
        Parameters:
        cardBean - CardBean object to which the toolbar should offer its functionalities.

      • getToolBar

        public javax.swing.JToolBar getToolBar()
        Return the internal JToolBar object which provides the toolbar functionality.
        Returns:
        JToolBar object, which provides functionalities in order to work with the currently selected card.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method handels the user input on the toolbar.
        • If the user hits the delete button, observers will be notified together with notification object String 'delete'.
        • If the user hits the edit button, a DialogMaintainCardObservable object will be created and displayed in order to provide the maintenance UI for the currently selected CardBean object.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        This method implements the reaction of regarding notifications from observed objects.
        • If the source of the notification is an DialogMaintainCardObservable object, the notification will simply be forwarded to observers of this class
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o -
        arg -
